intro: Dupatya consanguinea, commonly known as the Philippine violet, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Violaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests. It has simple, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
